sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is distributive over intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1,3,5} and B = {2,5,7}. Determine (A ∩ B) x C, where C = {0,1}.
message_2:
First, we need to find the intersection of sets A and B, which is represented by A ∩ B. The intersection of two sets contains all the elements that are common to both sets. In this case, A ∩ B = {5}, since 5 is the only element that appears in both sets.

Next, we need to find the Cartesian product of the intersection (A ∩ B) and set C. The Cartesian product of two sets is the set of all ordered pairs (a, b) where a is an element of the first set and b is an element of the second set.

In this case, the Cartesian product (A ∩ B) x C is the set of all ordered pairs (a, c) where a is an element of {5} and c is an element of {0,1}.

So, (A ∩ B) x C = {(5,0), (5,1)}
